description.narrative: The Vietnam Delta Study initiative provides support to the International Centre for Environment Management to deliver technical support to the Government of Vietnam for implementation of the Vietnam Delta Study. Rapidly evolving plans for hydropower development on the main stem and tributaries of the Mekong River has the potential to lead to detrimental effects on the Mekong Delta such a the blocking of fish migration, attenuation of flood pulses and capture of silt will lead to a reduction in output from farms fisheries, and the loss land due to subsiding of the silt-fed plains. These effects could have implications for regional food security and political stability. The key focus is to safeguard the Mekong Delta, its resources, economies and natural systems, and to ensure the continued well-being of Delta communities and their livelihoods, through informed and scientifically justified decision-making toward sustainable development, management and protection of water and related reso
